bug.summary: [Bug] DLPack tensor seg faults when calling `tensor.device`
bug.description:
After <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/37944>#37944</denchmark-link> , the bug below happens. As I tested, if remove the added , the codes below work fine. Do you have any idea what's the proper way to use TFE_Context here? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sanjoy>@sanjoy</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/alextp>@alextp</denchmark-link>
import tensorflow as tf a = tf.constant([1]) dlpack_arr = tf.experimental.dlpack.to_dlpack(a) tf_tensor = tf.experimental.dlpack.from_dlpack(dlpack_arr) print(tf_tensor) # This works fine print(tf_tensor.device) # Segment fault here. Works well without #37944 System information
OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): Ubuntu 16.04 TF Version: latest nightly build or installed from source
